header.title: CODEX TENEBRARUM / TENEBRAE PRIMAE
header.category: Chaosophy, Anti-Cosmic Satanism, Dark Esotericism, Cosmology

central_thesis: This text presents a radical anti-cosmic philosophy where primordial Chaos and Darkness are the ultimate, boundless reality. The Light and its created Universe (associated with '7' or 'god') are portrayed as a parasitic anomaly, a rupture in the original integrity of Chaos. The ultimate aim is the dissolution of the Light and the Universe, facilitating a return to and expansion of the primordial state of Chaos, Darkness, and Hell, which is an active, evolving force of cosmic de-creation.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Primordial Supremacy of Chaos and Darkness
structure_content.summary: Establishes Chaos and Darkness as the primordial, timeless, infinite source and essence of all, residing in the Abyss (Abaddon). They are described as the origin, plenitude, and repository of all wisdom and madness, embodying Leviathan and Demogorgon.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Emergence and Nature of Light and the Universe
structure_content.summary: Details how Light emerged as a parasitic, alien 'seed of all opposite' from Chaos, initiating war, division, and confusion. Light created the limited Universe (kosmos) and the '7' (god/angels) to fence itself off from Chaos, aiming for stasis and perfection.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Cosmic Conflict: Chaos, Darkness, and Hell vs. Light and the Universe
structure_content.summary: Describes the ongoing 'cruel war' where Light binds Chaos (Behemoth) within the Universe. Hell and Death (created by Samael) are presented as powers against '7' and Life, working to dissolve cosmic structures and return all to primordial non-existence. Abaddon is the Abyss where Chaos accumulates strength.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Role and Dual Nature of Man
structure_content.summary: Man is created by '7' in their image from Behemoth, intended to serve '7'. However, Man, being of Behemoth's flesh, is also susceptible to the influence of Hell, which offers 'Knowledge of his nature and mortality', allowing him to fall out of the Light and align with Chaos/Darkness.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Fallen Angels and Devils: Agents of Dissolution
structure_content.summary: Introduces 'Fallen' (Lightbearing, Azazel, Angels of Darkness) as entities who rebelled against Light, pierce the Universe, and aspire to the Abyss. They are described as the principles and powers of Evil, manifesting as destruction against '7's creation, bringing Knowledge, Power, and Doom.

Defines Evil not as a moral concept, but as primordial processes inherent in Chaos and Darkness, an active force of dissolution originating from Satan. Evil's purpose is to break barriers, destroy the Light's creations, and restore the primordial integrity of Leviathan, expanding into unlimited emptiness.

structure_content.chapter_title: Hell: The Zenith of Chaos and Darkness
structure_content.summary: Hell is presented as the ultimate evolution and manifestation of Chaos, an 'Indivisible and absolute totality of the essence of Hell' that is 'New' and 'will be'. It embodies the full potential of Chaos, uniting infinite centers, with Demogorgon of Hell at its core. It is the self-dependent transformation of Chaos energy into a state of infinite expansion.

Asserts Hell's creative power and eternal expansion, culminating in the destruction of '7' and the Universe. The 'success of Hell is an act of 666'. The text concludes with an emphasis on experiencing Chaos and the Abyss, positing this 'thirst' as the only imperishable reality.

key_concepts.definition: The primordial, boundless, formless, and infinite source of all existence and non-existence, residing in the Abyss. They are the 'plenitude' and 'bosom of any Wisdom and Madness', continually expanding and developing 'Themselves'.

The primordial emptiness, tartaros of discreation, and unlimited space beyond the Universe where Chaos and Darkness reside. It is the ultimate destination for the 'Fallen' and the source of strength for Hell.
The 'Primordial ocean of Chaos and Darkness, Protomatter and Metareason', the 'Indivisible United Spirit' that embodies the entire might and versatility of Chaos, breaking the chains of Behemoth.

The 'United Name' of Chaos and Darkness, representing the indivisible essence of many and each. It is also described as the 'primordial tree of any essence of Darkness' and 'Demogorgon of Hell', signifying the unified core of both.

The 'Heart of Darkness', 'The Dragon of The Abyss', and the 'Highest One in Chaos and Darkness'. Satan is the indivisible essence and initial cause of all reasons within Darkness and Chaos, and the source from which all Evil comes.

A parasitic manifestation that 'stood out from' Chaos, forming a 'seed of all opposite' to Chaos's development. It is the reason for cosmic war, division, and the creation of the limited Universe (kosmos), aspiring to stasis and 'complete perfection'.

The 'highest' entities in Light and Logos, the primogenitor of centers in the Universe. They are the creators of the Universe and Man, representing the principles of Life, Harmony, and Sanctity, seen as an obstacle to Chaos.

A closed, limited space created by the Light as a matter and spirit, distinct from the primordial Chaos. It is a distortion of divine principles in Chaos, an illusion, and a temporary construct destined to return to the Abyss.

The 'surface of Chaos' that was bound and restrained by the Light within the limits of the begotten kosmos. It is the 'Ancient Beast of Chaos' contained in matter, from whom all animals and man are incarnated.

Created by Samael (Silt of Chaos) as an inevitability and limit to all created things in the Universe. Death is an 'immeasurable strength' that purifies matter from Light, returns Life to non-existence, and is a power against '7' and Life.

The self-dependent evolution of Chaos in the free state of the Abyss, an active, expanding entity embodying the 'whole complexity of the potential of Chaos'. It is the 'Highest' and 'will be', not merely a place but the essence of ultimate return and destruction of Light.

Not a moral concept, but a primordial process inherent in Chaos and Darkness, an 'active work of Chaos, Darkness and Hell'. It signifies dissolution, breaking barriers, and the continuous development of Darkness aimed at destroying Light and restoring Chaos's integrity.

Entities who rose against the Light, aspiring 'down, into the Abyss'. They are described as 'princes of Darkness' (Lightbearing, Azazel), 'Devils', and 'Angels of Darkness' who realize metamorphoses and bring 'Knowledge, Power and Doom' to human history by tearing cosmic knots.
A numerical symbol representing the 'act of success' for Hell, marking its triumph over the Light and the Universe.

practical_system.description: The text is primarily a philosophical and cosmological treatise rather than a step-by-step practical manual. However, it implicitly outlines an operative path centered on alignment with Chaos, Darkness, and Hell. The 'practical system' involves recognizing the Light and Universe as an illusion and a parasitic construct, and striving to dissolve its influence within oneself and, by extension, the cosmos. This involves aspiring 'down, into the Abyss', experiencing the 'state' of Chaos, and embracing 'Evil' as the process of de-creation. Man's role is to become a 'mirror of Darkness' and an agent of Hell, allowing his predetermination to 'ruin' (from the perspective of Light) to manifest through the 'deeds of Hell' and the acquisition of 'Knowledge of his nature and mortality' from Hell.
tools: The 'thirst to experience the Abyss' as a primary internal drive and method.
Internal transformation and dissociation from the 'Light's spirit' and 'predetermination to ruin'.
The 'Knowledge of his nature and mortality' gained from Hell, enabling self-realization outside the Light's paradigm.
The individual practitioner's consciousness, utilized as a 'mirror of Darkness' to manifest its essence.
rituals: Aspiring into the Abyss and experiencing the 'state' of Chaos.
Engaging in 'deeds of Hell' (implied as actions that contribute to the dissolution of Light's creations and cosmic order).
Seeking 'Knowledge of his nature and mortality' through Hell's influence, leading to a 'fall out of the Light'.
Becoming a 'mirror of Darkness' or an agent of Hell, actively working against '7' and the Universe.

relevant_quotes.text: Light became the reason of the war in Chaos, longing till the last term of Time;
Hell is New; It did not exist, but It will be, as It is.
Evil is the processes, proceeding in the Abyss, inherent in Chaos and Darkness;
The success of Hell is an act of 666.

This work is done only For The Sake Of Hell, It is not the finished answer or a limit of cognition, for there is no language of flesh to describe absolutely that, what is Darkness and Chaos, and there is no human reason, which could get Them inside;
There is the only one imperishable reality in the world of illusions - it is the thirst to experience the Abyss.
None should explain Chaos - one has to feel Its state;

critical_analysis.relevance: This text offers a potent and internally consistent anti-cosmic cosmology within Western Esotericism, aligning with currents of Chaosophy and radical Left Hand Path Satanism. It provides a foundational philosophical framework for practices aimed at cosmic dissolution and personal apotheosis through identification with primordial Chaos/Darkness. While drawing on Gnostic dualistic themes, it inverts the traditional valuation, positing the demiurgic Light not as merely ignorant but as an actively parasitic and detrimental force to be overcome. Its redefinition of 'Evil' as a cosmic, de-creative process rather than a moral failing is a key contribution to dark esotericism, providing a rationale for working with forces often labelled 'dark' or 'destructive'. It resonates with certain Qliphothic and Draconian perspectives but pushes further into a realm of primordial, uncreated non-existence as the ultimate reality.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of experienced practitioners and theoreticians within Left Hand Path traditions, anti-cosmic Satanism, Chaos Magic, and dark esotericism. It is for individuals seeking a rigorous, nihilistic, or destructive cosmological and ontological framework, particularly those interested in challenging conventional notions of creation, divinity, and personal existence through identification with forces of dissolution and primordial chaos. It demands a high degree of conceptual engagement and is not intended for beginners or those seeking a 'light' or syncretic magical system.
